keyMoments.title: Sentomaru's Debut
keyMoments.description: Sentomaru arrives with Pacifista PX-1 and introduces himself as the strongest guard in the world and Dr. Vegapunk's bodyguard.
keyMoments.significance: First introduction of a character who becomes a recurring antagonist and eventually plays a major role in the Egghead arc.
keyMoments.quote: I'm Sentomaru, the strongest guard in the world! And I won't tell you anything!

keyMoments.title: Sentomaru Uses Ashigara Dokkoi
keyMoments.description: Sentomaru demonstrates his signature technique, an open-palm Haki strike that sends Luffy flying without direct contact.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Sentomaru's combat abilities and one of the early clear displays of Armament Haki in the anime.

abilities.description: An open-palm strike enhanced with Armament Haki that doesn't need to physically connect to cause devastating damage.
Sentomaru can use Armament Haki to strike opponents without direct contact.

relationships.description: Sentomaru serves as Dr. Vegapunk's personal bodyguard.

evolutionMoments.description: Sentomaru identifies himself as Vegapunk's bodyguard.

reveals.information: Bodyguard of Dr. Vegapunk and captain of the Marines' Science Unit
Uses Armament Haki, not Devil Fruit powers
Claims to have the tightest lips in the world while ironically revealing information

keyMoments.title: Orders Crew to Split Up
keyMoments.description: Luffy makes the difficult decision to split the crew into three groups to escape, showing rare tactical thinking and acceptance that they cannot win this fight.
keyMoments.significance: A pivotal moment showing Luffy's growth as a captain and marking the beginning of the crew's tragic separation.
keyMoments.quote: Listen up! We're splitting into three groups! Meet back at the Sunny in three days!

reveals.information: Luffy demonstrates tactical maturity by ordering a retreat when outmatched

keyMoments.title: Gravely Wounded by Kizaru
keyMoments.description: Admiral Kizaru intercepts Zoro's group and gravely wounds him with a light beam attack, leaving him at death's door.
keyMoments.significance: One of Zoro's most serious injuries in the series, demonstrating the overwhelming power of an Admiral.
